page.title: 04The Church,Llanddulas.
page.content: St.Cynbryd's Church is situated near the old part of the village.It was first built in the 5th century.Since then the building has been extended and changed. The church today is much bigger than the old one.The lectern has a golden eagle standing on a gold ball which is very pretty.This has been used by 42 rectors from 1357. Half of Llanddulas school children were christened in St.Cynbryds , and the other half in St.Cynfrans, which is our sister church in Llysfaen.The church gives you money boxes,and many other things such as flowers for our mothers on mothers day.The church always used to be open,but now they lock it just till Sunday,then many people come.The graveyard is nicely set out,and there is an unusual lych gate with a roof on it.
